page.title: 04The Lanes Carlisle (i)
page.content: The Lanes Redevelopment was opened in November 1984 by the Duke of Gloucester when he and a St.Aidan's pupil buried a "time capsule" in the central concourse.{Grapes, Globe,}and {New}Lanes provide sheltered thorough- fares for pedestrian shoppers, who have a choice of five major stores (Fine Fare, C & A, County Store, B.H.S. and Mothercare ) and about 40 other shops. The original "Lanes" were mediaeval alleys between Lowther and Scotch Streets, named after inns.Much of the property decayed to the point where whole shops were in danger of collapse. The scheme finally adopted preserved the 18th and 19th century shop fronts of Scotch Street as replicas, and the names of two of the Lanes, if not their original lines. {Continued on Page 5 >>}
